text.p: The Australian Securities Commission said on Monday that the Federal Court had ordered the appointment of a liquidator to metals trader and processor Harringtons Ltd and its unit, Harringtons Metallurgists Ltd.
The court ordered that Simon Alexander Wallace-Smith of Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu be appointed official liquidator.
Harringtons had an estimated deficiency of assets of A$21.9 million and Harringtons Metallurgists had a deficiencey of A$14.3 million, with A$2.4 million owed to metal creditors.

"Today's actions were taken to assist in the protection, preservation and if necessary prompt recovery of property of both companies," ASC Victorian Regional Commissioner Bernie Mithen said in a statement.
Harrington's shares last traded at 7.5 cents on May 5, 1995.
